page.title: 07Housing
page.content: Almost all the houses around here are very old. Most are farm houses or cottages for farm workers which are now lived in by people working in local towns or as holiday homes. The newest houses are in Whitton itself where there are four council houses. There are some new bungalows scattered about but these are mostly owned by farmers for their sons or parents. Lots of the old houses have been rebuilt but the holiday cottages are empty for most of the year.Most villages have new houses - but the land at Whitton is mostly owned by the Dame Anna Child's Charity and they have not sold land for building on. The people who live in Whitton do not work there, they travel several miles mostly to go to local towns or farms.The biggest houses in Whitton are the Rectory and School House.
